As someone who has played since launch but not consistently. The game has had its up and plenty of its downs and I mean a lot. Others rose to dethrone it and failed but not without a valiant effort. It's hard to establish a foothold in a genre that didn't really exist and keep going (almost 4 years to-date) while still having a player base as well as a development team that didn't abandon ship.

The game will never be truly balanced. You will lose, a lot. From being tunneled by the killer or getting destroyed by competent survivors. This is paired with the continual release of perks from killers/survivors joining the fray.

Overall, I've loved this game. I wish my hours reflected more of that but even I took Matt's message to heart. "Play something else." You won't ever hear a Dev tell you to take a break from their own game and with that, I respect the man despite how much of a meme he has been in the first couple of years.

Events:
With the release of Tomes/Rifts, I absolutely loathe the game more than ever. Granted past objective events were not at all that great. This requires more play time.

TL;DR
Recommend: Yes but be prepared to feel like in an abusive relationship.

If I were to have reviewed this game a year ago, I would not have recommended it. Not because I disliked it, quite the contrary. I LOVE this game. I have found me frequently coming back to this game and playing for a few days at a time to experience all the new content. Its a long way from 2.5 killers and 4 survivors that it started with. Every single killer feels unique and has gotten the TLC they deserved to the point where killers like the spirit and the clown can hold a candle to the horror legends that they hunt through the fog with. I have been a proud Freddy main since he released two years ago, because I found enjoyment in his character and being able to take out my irl frustrations on several unsuspecting victims. And I say that despite the lack of ability to kill anyone that he was given. It just felt so satisfying to be the underdog, every down and every hook I could get leading me closer to seeing those salty survivor tears.. those tears who lost to a pre-rework Freddy in a meta where 1k was a big ask. Then the dev team just had to go and make the game better.

TL;DR Pretty Good Job So Far!

"Dead by Daylight" era uma ideia promissora e desafiadora para a época, e reconheço que ele trouxe uma mecânica que até o momento não existia, popularizando em massa esse estilo de jogo de Slasher x Sobreviventes que temos no mercado dos video-jogos (Deceit, White Noise 1/2 e etc...). Mas na minha opinião, a própria empresa do jogo deixou com que ele morresse na praia, trazendo um sistema desbalanceado em massa com os assassinos pagos do jogo que chega a desmotivar qualquer jogador que jogue como sobrevivente. Depois de algumas horas de jogo; a experiência começa a se tornar frustrante com uma comunidade tóxica e com um Matchmaking que não funciona há um ano, tentei por três dias seguidos jogar esse jogo como um assassino e não consegui em nenhum momento, enfim, se esse jogo um dia foi bom, hoje não é mais...
Dead by Daylight is such a unique game that it even has moving bushes, they are called blendette's!!! :)

[h1] What I personally think about Dead by Daylight [/h1]

Dead by Daylight to me tends to be a complete love/hate relationship rollercoaster. I only ever play as survivor, and to the other survivor mains who might read this (god bless if you do), you WILL get upset from time to time. Weather you thought the game was unfair b/c either the killer tunneled or camped you, but try not to hold a vendetta on the game itself. Personally I play with a few friends and it makes the game a lot more fun and easy going instead of solo queuing and taking it way too competitively. You will get better, just keep playing matches and learn from your mistakes. Learn new strats and look up some nice perk builds. And the killer mains out there, I hit rank 1 so easy dubs

De los mejores juegos 1v4 por ahi
Saben manejar bien que no sea injusto, depende mucho de la habilidad del jugador, en ocasiones un solo survivor puede distraer al killer toda la partida, o un killer puede matar a todos en un segundo

There are 2 games which I play to this extent. R6: Siege with 600 hours. And this with 200 hours. I play alot of other games, but for some reason this one is super satisfying, both as a survivor and a killer. Alot of people, including quite a few of my friends, do not like this game, and at first I can understand why. But to be completely honest, if you just put time, effort and a bit of video watching on Youtube, you get better and it starts getting super addictive. It is alot unlike other games so don't get discouraged by the learning curve. Last but not least, this game I believe was made by creators in Quebec, Canada which is my home province and there's alot of pride to that for me. I want to show as much support as I can. Hopefully this review was somewhat helpful. Much love.

Simple and to the point. I love this game. 
Dead by Daylight is tons of fun, especially with Survive with Friends.
Adrenaline pumping and sometimes rage inducing but never gets old.
A word of warning: Community can be pretty toxic, not uncommon for a competitive online game, but something to mention.

This is the best fun you can have killing real players as Freddy Krueger. This is however, the least fun you can have running from Freddy Krueger. This game is slowly becoming less and less fun for the runners depending on who you go against, so since that's supposed to be 80% of the playerbase, I can't really recommend this game to most people who want to play alone. It is however, plenty of fun with friends, and as the killer, consistently. 

But since that's not most people, thumbs down for me. Also every patch brings a swarm of game breaking bugs, and they have a history of going on vacation right after big bugs so they don't fix any of them. Which is every christmas. Which is in like a month.

Update: The current patch is poggers. But they are still adding more and more boring people to run from. The most recent 3 however, have been very fun to go against. (One of them lets you kick a baby, it's poggers)

The grind makes this game hard to suggest to new players or friends. 800+ hrs in game and I still don't have every perk unlocked. It sucks a lot of the fun out of the game when in-game currency is a large influence on normal play.
